title: Right Triangles
text: What is the distinguishing degree in a right triangle?

title: Understanding Right Triangles
text: Right triangles are triangles where one angle is exactly 90°. These triangles are special because they allow us to use basic trigonometric functions like sine, cosine, and tangent to relate the angles and sides. In addition, the Pythagorean Theorem can be used to find the length of a missing side when two sides are known.

title: Oblique Triangles
text: An oblique triangle is any triangle that is not a right triangle. In oblique triangles, we cannot directly use the basic trigonometric ratios like we do in right triangles. Instead, we must use more complex methods like the Law of Sines or the Law of Cosines to solve for unknown sides or angles.
